page.title: 12ENTERTAINMENT IN ASHILL
page.content: The{Community centre}is the venue for most local entertainment.{Dances}are often held on Friday or Saturday night music usually a{DISCO}but sometimes local groups or small bands.The dances usually raise money for charity or local organisations.Occasional public dances are held at the{Leisure Centre on a floor laid over the indoor bowls green.The Youth Club runs monthly "under 13" Disco's.The{"Entertainers" village drama group puts on a{PANTO, "Robinson Crusoe" for Jan 1986,and a summer{play}each year,tickets Â£1 for adults,50p children.Prize{BINGO's}are held for local charities in the weeks leading up to Christmas.A{"GIVE US A {CLUE"}based on the T.V. series is held yearly,{Whist}drives each Saturday,and occasionaly Fridays.Outdoor{FETE's}are held annually for the Church and Ashill Village Aid.
